NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF EDUCATIONAL BROADCASTERS
UNIVERSITY OF ILLINOIS
NAEB TAPE NETWORK
September 4, 1951
Prof. F. S. Siebert
Director, School of Journalism and Communications
University of Illinois
Dear Prof. Siebert:
At this time I should like to request the assignment of
at least one, and preferably two, graduate assistants for
the coming year.
As you know the main office of the NAEB is in the process
of being set up. As part of that program, and for the network
as well, there is a small item in the budget for promotion
and publicity. It is such a small item that if we hired a
person to do the job there wouldnâ€™t be any funds for printing,
cuts, matts, etc. So, it would seem that graduate students
in Journalism and Communications would be most useful in this
capacity.
Perc Tannenbaum would be ideally suited for such a job,
and if convenient to your plans and budget I would be deeply
appreciative if he could be assigned to us. Anyone of the
remaining assistants would probably serve as the second
one.
I am hopeful that such a plan can be fitted into your
budget and the requirements of the rest of the school. At
any rate, we would appreciate any consideration you can
give to this request.
Many thanks.
Richard L. Rider
Manager
C A
